surface.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the top layer of an area of water or land
surface.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface.
Dead leaves floated on the surface of the water.
The tunnel was some 300 feet below the surface.
surface.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the outside or top layer of something
surface.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The road surfaces tend to be worse in the towns than in the country.
a frying pan with a non-stick surface
mold growing on the cheese’s surface
surface.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a flat area on the top of a cupboard, table, desk etc, that you use for cooking or working on
surface.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Work on a clean, flat surface.
Keep kitchen surfaces clean and tidy.
surface.translation[0].definitions[3].de: one of the sides of an object
surface.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: How many surfaces does a cube have?
surface.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 2: the outside or top layer of something
surface.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The upper surface of the leaf is dull green.
The outer surface of the shell is ridged.
Marble provides a cool smooth surface.
I reached out and touched the rough surface of the stone wall.
Many floor tiles have textured surfaces to make them less slippery underfoot.
The path has a hard surface suitable for wheelchairs and pushchairs.
This type of cloth has a shiny surface on one side.
I didn't want to spill anything on the polished surface of the table.
Put the compass on a flat surface.
surface.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if information, feelings, or problems surface, they become known about or easy to notice
surface.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: the jealousy that had surfaced in her
Rumors about the killings have begun to surface in the press.
surface.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time
surface.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Last year Toole surfaced again in Cuba.
surface.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to rise to the surface of water
surface.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to get out of bed, especially late
surface.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: Joe never surfaces before midday on Sunday.
surface.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to put a surface on a road
surface.translation[2].definitions[0].de: relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
surface.translation[2].definitions[1].de: appearing to be true or real, but not representing what someone really feels or what something is really like
surface.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Beneath the surface calm, she felt very insecure.
